sense.gloss: third party, third person, outsider, disinterested person
third month of the lunar calendar
samadhi (state of intense concentration achieved through meditation)
being absorbed in, being immersed in, doing to one's heart's content, indulging in
three parts, three components, three factors, three aspects
real world, IRL, in real life
three wheeled vehicle (tricycle, motorcycle, etc.), three wheeler
paltry amount of money, cheapness, worthlessness
festival (shrine visit) by children aged 7, 5 and 3
cooperation with singleness of purpose (e.g. between companies), operating in tandem
rope used to cordon off consecrated areas or as a talisman against evil
Japan, China and India, Japan, Korea and China, the whole world
Records of the Three Kingdoms (Chinese historical text)
Grand Empress Dowager, the Empress Dowager and the Empress Consort
San'etsu (the three former provinces of Echizen, Etchū and Echigo)
three temporal states of existence, past, present and future
day laborer (in construction, etc.), day labourer
Mikawa (former province located in the east of present-day Aichi Prefecture)
three banishment punishments (of different severity; under ritsuryō system)
Sanriku (the three former provinces of Rikuzen, Rikuchū and Rikuō)
person who cannot stick to anything, unsteady worker, monk for three days
separation of powers (legislative, executive and judicial)
mitsuba (Cryptotaenia japonica), Japanese honewort, Japanese honeywort, Japanese chervil, Japanese parsley

sdata.j: ↑授業↑↓じゅぎょう↓は↑八↑↓はち↓↑時↑↓じ↓↑三↑↓さん↓↑十↑↓じゅっ↓↑分↑↓ぷん↓から↑始↑↓はじ↓まるから。
sdata.e: Class doesn't begin until eight-thirty.
